title: Between 1 October 2017 and 30 September 2018, will an armed group from Afghanistan engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in Afghanistan?
preds: Based on general news and GJP consensus.

A thousand civilians look like a lot in this low intensity conflict (more likely: a thousand military or police troops, cumulative), however one cannot confidently predict a near-zero chance, these being pretty volatile folks. Trend (based on general news) suggests relative calm for me, though.
ISIS is diminishing from Iraq and Afghans have more than enough issues with Taliban and previous Afghan presidents claims US inability in dealing with Afghanistan
Based on general news and GJP consensus.

http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-41708357
Somebody or other will manage to kill a thousand civilians in Afghanistan.  Those people will be dead and their surviving family members and friends will be bereft.  However, if no single group steps forward to claim them, they will not show up in the EWP scorecard.  It is hard to know how to feel about this, but staying low for the moment anyway.

@ February.
